system-check-subtitle: Track server load, multi-site availability, SEO readiness, directory permissions, and crawler signals in one place.
system-check-section-server-desc: Key runtime indicators from the current machine.
system-check-server-php-hint: Recommended to run PHP 8.1 or above for better performance and security.
system-check-server-memory-hint: Allocate at least 256 MB to handle bulk publishing and crawler simulations.
system-check-server-max-execution-hint: Long-running imports or spider reports may require more than 120 seconds.
system-check-server-disk-hint: Keep at least 20% free space to leave room for cache, logs, and backups.
system-check-server-cpu-hint: Sustained load higher than the CPU core count indicates saturation.
system-check-server-uptime-hint: Recent reboots may indicate instability or planned maintenance.
system-check-server-extensions-hint: Enable curl, mbstring, intl, gd, and openssl for SEO integrations and media processing.
system-check-section-sites-desc: Check content freshness and storage permissions for each managed site.
system-check-site-empty: No site content directories were detected yet.
system-check-empty-seo: No SEO checks were generated yet.
system-check-section-seo-desc: Ensure each basic SEO signal is ready before launching a new batch.
system-check-seo-robots-hint: Place a robots.txt file at the web root to guide crawlers.
system-check-seo-sitemap-hint: Generate sitemap.xml regularly to accelerate indexation.
system-check-seo-https-hint: Enable HTTPS to avoid duplicate indexing and improve ranking.
system-check-seo-canonical-hint: Activate canonical/opengraph plugins to ship structured signals.
system-check-section-directories-desc: Writable directories are required for publishing, cache, and log storage.
system-check-section-spider-desc: Quick snapshot of recent crawler visits collected from spider logs.
system-check-spider-empty: No spider logs detected yet. The system will display data after the first crawl is recorded.
